Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2012 03:08PM OM12 wrote: Hi Shabby, I've been drinking at least 8 glasses of water every day and making sure I'm getting fruits and veggies, so haven't needed any kind of softening... I don't think that a stool softener is something you need to do prior, but that said, have you ever had any surgeries before or had to take painkillers? If so that might help you to decide... Britishlass- funny, I was just noticing today that a freckle and some stretch marks I have are now in different places, a little weird, but reminded me of this whole thing - a little rearranged, but still the same person! On a funnier note, I decided I was feeling good enough to put on a regular sports bra this am (one that you slip on, no fasteners) well, I got stuck halfway thru the procedure and had to holler at my daughter to go get my hub out of the garage because I needed help, he came running up the stairs so fast I think he thought I was bleeding out... When he saw me tangled in the bra he just started laughing... So much for dignity! : )
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2012 07:53AM OM12 wrote: hi ladies - just popping in to say hi, scrolled through some of the posts Just -  as always, you just keep on amazing us all...  I know you have dark days, but I am still just in awe of your ability to power through nbnotes - I was blown away by your news, you are in my thoughts...  Omeggo -  I'm glad you've reached a decision, I agree, sometimes just making the decision is half the battle Tazzy - I'm still feeling numbness, pain, zings, etc. as well... and same, the docs, etc. all say that it will pass As for me, I was moving along, going to physio twice a week (trying to get a handle on the highness/firmness of the implant) and then boom - all of a sudden I was starting to sleep more, interact less, feeling really low, started getting panicky all over again... yup, ptsd... Luckily I have been seeing a psychologist thoughout this whole process and she and my gp recognised it for what it was right away, I decided to take some low dose antidepressants and it seems to be helping a little.  But what a shocker.  Honestly, I never thought that I would be someone that would experience this...  Isn't it amzing that many of us that are experiencing these symptoms are on a similar timeline... I've got to wonder if it might also be a little seasonal, with the weather turning dimmer and grayer it brings out the worst in our psyche. Stay strong ladies, keep walking in the sunshine and taking joy where you can - I'll be thinking of all of you when I lift my face to the sun... OM12
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2012 07:56AM OM12 wrote: Hi ladies - I haven't posted here before, but recognize some names for other threads. I had mx of the right last Wednesday with direct implant (using alloderm and a silicone implant), and a reduction and lift to the left and sentinel node biopsy, I think she took 3 nodes. Days 2 & 3 after surgery were ok, but about day 5 the achiness set in, drains (2 in same spot) were pulled Monday, Tuesday was agony, swelling, some fluid, etc. but here I am on Friday 9 days later, feeling ok, can even sleep slightly sideways and am down to only 3 Tramadol a day. Now I'm just waiting for path report. The sleep deprivation is killer for everyone, but just think for us August girls by the time the leaves turn and we have to put on heavier coats, we'll all be able to move our arms! : ). Feel free to post any questions and I'll keep an eye and try my best to answer. Stay strong ladies and remember to breathe deeply whenever possible. OM
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2012 08:37AM OM12 wrote: Hi ladies - wishing you all a very Merry Christmas, happy holiday and a healthy 2013... I for one will be happy to see the backside of 2012!  What a strong, courageous, funny, fabulous group the August ladies are - I think of you all often and wish you the very best. *< : )    (christmas elf!)
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2012 01:55PM OM12 wrote: Hi all - doc just called with the path results - WOO HOO. Pure DCIS. Nothing in the nodes, nothing in the tissue taken from the left breast! I am DONE!!!! Doc said it was high grade and lots of it, likely on its way to becoming invasive so mastectomy was the right choice (although I bet they say that to all us MX girls ;) no chemo required!! Anyhow, the fact that she called at 4:30 on a Friday to give me this news restores my faith in all good things. It's been a hell of a trip, and I am so bloody thankful to be shed of it all. Now I just hope this implant settles into place, the swelling continues to go down and someday soon I'll be able to sleep on anything other than by back!!! To all the August ladies still on the road, stay strong - I'll keep checking in from time to time, and feel free to PM me as I have an alert to my mail for that, but I am going to take this bookmark off my toolbar, I need to close this chapter and move on. A million thanks to you all for sharing the tears, trials and now triumphs as we journey through this, it makes me so grateful that we have this technology to connect to each other. You will all remain in my heart and i will continue to send you all good vibes. Peace and well being ladies.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2012 12:28PM OM12 wrote: Shabby, I was only there one night and did not use a thing I brought... I wore the hospital nightgown and pj bottoms, didn't feel up to reading, etc. only thing I guess I did use was my toothbrush and I liked having my iPhone only because I liked knowing the time! I wore the same clothes home that I wore there, so didn't even need a change (yoga pants and zip up short sleeve top). If you're there longer you may want to bring some personal items, but honestly, the hospital should have everything you need - oh, except I did wish I had brought some sweat socks as my toes were a little chilly...but the nurses bring warm blankets, so even that wasn't really a must have!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2012 06:58PM OM12 wrote: Those recovering - and those beginning ... Thinking about meteors and the Olympics ending, everyone tonight - if you can, on the breath in (pure) on the breathe out (love). Feel it about your dh, about your kids, about your partner, about whatever makes up your family, feel It about yourselves. Just feel it. Breath in, through your nose, think the thought, fill up your tummy so it's nice and round, then breathe out the word love. Peace ladies.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2012 08:00PM OM12 wrote: Hi ladies, ottawamom12 here (I shortened my name down to OM12) - haven't been on the boards lately, I am so incredibly exhausted. 15 days out and I'm more tired now then in the week following. No joke, 3 hour naps daily... Damiana - I'm having crazy pain under my armpit too, I've taken to wearing this one tank top I have cinched up under my armpit so no skin touches other skin... But it is so uncomfortable, and makes me not want to move my arm at all (which is impossible because I'm right handed), plus then I freak myself out if I don't move my arm because I think i'll get frozen shoulder or something awful. Ugh. I finally shaved a little yesterday, but don't know if that helped or further irritated... I'm antsy as can be too, path report coming in on Monday... For those getting drains out, I'm relatively thin and it didn't exactly hurt me, just felt really creepy - kind of like an emery board was being dragged along a back rib... Hope that doesnt freak anyone out! But it was fast. And life without drains is so much better.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2012 07:05PM OM12 wrote: Tazzy - I'm so sorry those drains are still in. We're all sending you positive thoughts and picturing cool, calming breezes to soothe those infected sites. Don't wear yourself out this weekend, focus on getting better.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2012 06:54PM OM12 wrote: Damiana - drugs are prescribed for a reason, I used them (and am still using them) as one of the nurses said, there's no reason to deal with this AND experience pain, take the Meds as long as you need and don't feel badly. Mel - lymphadema is very present in my mind as well, if you google post mx exercises there are lots of good ones, my main thing has been holding my arms out straight in front of me and circling my wrists and making fists, about once every few hours trying to pump fluid through my arm June - another thing you could try is lorazepam (Ativan) it's very low dose and quite calming, you need an rx for it, I took it for my MRI and to have my drains out, very helpful. Tazzy - sorry to hear your output is high, but really if you're still draining better to have them in then out and have to be aspirated, I hear that is not pleasant. Sleep well ladies - everyone take 5 big, deep, diaphragm pushing breaths - figure out your mantra... Some nights for me it's, "Be (on the breath in) well (on the breath out), some nights it's no (big breath) pain (big breath) and tonight it's sleep deep...
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2012 05:10PM OM12 wrote: Hi ladies - just popping in to see how you're all doing... Tazzy  - I'm in the same boat, still incredibly sore, all along my right ribs under my arm and toward my back, I think maybe where the drain was... there's fluid or something going on in there, feels weird and ouchy, sometimes like a burning pain... just generally icky. I also still have deep pain around my implant, docs have said same thing - major surgery, you need to stretch but it takes time to heal, your body has been thru trauma... I'm almost 6 weeks out though, so I feel like it should be better already. My PS said it would likely take 8 weeks. Justegan - I am just blown away by you, I can't believe you're back to school and back to teaching, you are one brave/amazing chick.  And I think it's awesome that you love your boobs - I'm so glad you get to have some happy out of this. Stay strong ladies - you're all very much in my thoughts.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2012 05:43PM OM12 wrote: Hi ladies - been offline for a bit, trying to catch up on the posts, shabby, great to hear the laughter in your posts! My hub and yours sound similar, he's been suggesting some rather interesting nip tattoos, and considers himself quite the comedian (winking eye and smiley face are his two top choices!) Not! For those still struggling with Bras - sears sells an excellent front zip sports bra by vogue, I found the band a little too tight at first, but just snipped some triangles in the elastic and it was great, super easy to get into. So went for my mtg with bs yesterday, path results still not in... Ugh. It's been almost 3 weeks. Good news is the bs said she would be very surprised if I needed chemo, and a friend of mine who's a GP said that was a positive as most docs will not offer any conjecture if they think there's a chance for the negative. I was quite the spectacle at the clinic, They took all the steristrips off, so I'm completely free now. I guess they don't get too many direct to implants so several nurses and a resident came in to have a look (they asked and i said sure) and the bs took photos, they all seemed very pleased with the outcome... Personally I think the foob looks a little flat, I thought it would be more rounded, but apparently there is still shifting. Tazzy - it's amazing isn't it, days ago we were barely able to focus on breathing, now I actually have many moments in the day where breast cancer is not the first thing on my mind. Sleep well ladies
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2012 08:47AM OM12 wrote: Hi ladies - just checking in, 4 mos out for me as of Dec 1.  Hard to believe! I'm glad to see many of you are movong on and away from the pain, and for those that aren't you're still in my thoughts and I'm wishing the best for you. Justine - glad to hear your SEs are mild, and I hope that continues for you.  I've got contracture around my implant too and the pain is centered around my lower under armpit area (where they took nodes as well), if that makes sense.  My physio & massage therapist say that it's also due to hunching over computer and too much mouse work.. muscles in my mid back and shoulders are tightening which is causing other muscles to pull in as well... she recommended that I try to lie on my back on the bed or couch and let my arm dangle off the edge while rolling my arm outwards (think of doing a snow angel and then turn your palms up).  Apparently it's not unusual to have pain caused from nerve regeneration at this point as well...  I can only imagine what the fatigue must be like dealing with this AND the treatment... I'm wiped just dealing with the pain & day to day life.  Hope the semester ends well and the pain subsides. All the best ladies! OM12
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2013 08:43AM - edited Apr 30, 2013 09:43AM by OM12 Hi ladies - long time no chat!  Sounds like most are doing well, which is so good to hear.  Listen a question for my August friends, for anyone that had reduction on the remaining breast, did anyone have any issues with sores (lesion, wound, ulcer?).  I developped this bizarre open sore at the bottom of my areola last week, pretty much where the stiches line is around the areola...  It literally came out of mowhere, just popped up and I only noticed it due to blood/pus (gross, I know) in my bra... Went in to see my GP, and she's sending me to my oncologist/surgeon, plastics and for an ultrasound!!!  Kind of freaking out a little, so I'm just wondering if anyone else has heard of anything like this... Thanks ladies!
